reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for easter weekend in the main hotel. The room was large and good, and everything was functioning well in it. Ours was on the ground floor. What I liked about the room was that it had french windows facing the eastern side, so we opened the heavy curtains which allowed sunlight to enter the room.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast bouffet and dinner were very good, with many choices. For lunch, we ate the beach which was very nice, as they did barbecue. On our first day it was grilled lobsters. The rest of the days it was meat and vegetables, though there were other choices, in addition to desserts and salads.
reviews.title: Heavenly Honeymoon!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were helpful in the restaurants and on the beach, always nice and smiling.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: There is indeed noise from the construction next door, though we did not get bothered by it, and we spent all our time at the beach. On one day, the music seemed too loud, and when I asked if the DJ could lower it down a bit, he most helpfully did. On following days its volume was fine. Regarding the airport, we did not notice any noise from it at all.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For water, we bought 750 ml bottles of water in the small supermarket outside of the hotel, and then just refilled them when they became empty in the hotel. There are water coolers at the beach pub, and the beach restaurant, which made it easier than keep asking for glasses of water.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never been to eygpt before and after looking for 3 weeks for a honeymoon destination, the best option for guranteed sunshine seemed to be eygpt.
reviews.title: Had a Excellent Time

likes.liked: — The great service from the staff
likes.disliked: — the pool table its a bit dated

reviews.text: After reading reviews for the Concorde El Salam, i took the plunge and booked the holiday via lastminute.com
reviews.title: best rest and relaxation could have asked for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we only stayed for a week, but i have to say its the best resort i have ever stayed at, when we arrived at the hotel the check in went via quickly, our bags where whisked of by the concierge and we were shown to our room with our bags lying in wait, the rooms where clean and tidy and very spacious we had the double room but the bed was huge we have a king size at home and this was at least an extra 3 foot wider, in the room you get a free safe and cable tv with a couple english channels and all the other essentials.
reviews.title: Just go there!

likes.liked: — The cleanliness, friendliness and sports facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two hotels to this complex the sport part and the front hotel(nearer the beach). we were in the sport part where the tennis courts, horse paddocks, ice skating etc... are located. there is a free shuttle bus every 5 minuntes from the front of the hotels with takes you to both parts of the complex or you could walk (its only 2 minutes away).
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever!

likes.liked: — That it had it's own private beach with a snorkelling jetty.
likes.disliked: — That the infinite pool wasn't heated! :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent there is plenty of choice for everyone, i had 3 courses for lunch and dinner every time, and didn't even put a pound on!
reviews.title: first class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Concorde hotel in April 15th-22nd. We were lucky enough to get a main hotel room which overlooked the aqua gym pool. The sports hotel looked fine, but even the staff said the rooms were nicer in the main hotel. Room itself was fine, the usual TV, fridge, good shower and all nice and clean. Comfy double queen beds were great with squidgy pillows too.
reviews.title: Good holiday at the Concorde, Sharm

likes.liked: — Great snorkelling, close to Naama Bay
likes.disliked: — Nothing really, although having to pay extra for things was a little annoying having paid for all inclusive.

reviews.title: Met expectation
reviews.text: We stayed all inclusive (AI), but this hotel still wanted extras!! We had to pay extra for cocktails, cappucinos, the Italian resturant - and you had to buy bottled water to use away from the restaurants which we thought was a bit tight, however it was so cheap to buy it wasnt a problem - just the principle!! We didnt have a list of what was included in AI but the reception gave us one, no problem. Apart from that, the food was good. Lots of choice and mostly recognisable, no evidence of yesterdays leftovers being re-served. They have a Movenpick icecream 'van' down by the italian resturant, 2 scoops was 80EP, about 80p - very nice although we both got the pharoahs revenge after the 2 times we had it, coincidence? The beach bar served nice BBQ'd chicken etc and salad at lunch, the italian did pizza/pasta/salad buffet which we ate most days. The main resturant also did a buffet lunch but it was quite similar to the dinners, so could get a bit samey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately you are more likley to get ill in Egypt than not, but dont bother with imodium - it doesnt work on these bugs! Take Diarolyte/rehydration sachets which do help a lot.
reviews.title: Surpassed expectations. . .
A Dream
reviews.text: The pools were all good, cold though but ok once you were in. The sea was no warmer although it was the best feature of the hotel by far - lovely coral beach and clear seas with a stable safe jetty with lifeguard. The snorkelling was amazing, better here than at the Ras Mohammed National Park. We even saw a sea turtle just off the beach along with the usual amazing fish and jellies. The current swimming towards the Hilton hotel was quite strong so be careful if you have kids or aren't a strong swimmer.

Sharm airport is like any other, busy, crowded and expensive! Its fine - just be aware that your gate will have your flight against it on the board below, and will start flashing when its time to queue up - there are no annoucements etc - until your name is called as last remining passengers etc!
reviews.title: Concorde El impressed me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Returned a week ago and never return to the same place, hotel twice but will definately make an exception in this case. From the start the hotel was brilliant, food wonderful and staff really helpful. The waiting staff, cleaners and reception staff were great. We stayed on the main side but went across to the sports side a few times. The pool was initially cold but soon became very welcome with 40+ degrees temperatures. The beach is small but the snorkelling made up for that, the fish were so close and the water so clear it was better than the Barrier Reef. We lost 2 days due to a funny tummy and the immodium do not work on the bug that you pick up there, dirolyte were fine. Due to loosing 2 days, this holiday went so fast, we will go for 10/11 nights or 2 weeks next time instead of just a week. We did the flight to Cairo which after initial difficulties with flights, was a fantastic day. This was down to the group we went with, 7 of us Brits and 2 Norweigens, a nicer bunch of people we could not have wished to meet, so Gary, Marg, Yan, David, Claire, James and who ever else we missed, a big thank you, we will always remember that day and cherish the photos. It pays to shop around for trips and excursions, at the pool the lads with the clip boards and books come round and are cheaper than the authorised reps so shop around. We were initially concerned regarding the security in Egypt and indeed had put this destination off a few times before taking the plunge, but we needed not worry, security is tight and actually gives you the confidence in your surroundings.
reviews.title: Can`t wait to go back

likes.disliked: — could not stay in it longer!!

reviews.text: Our room was lovely, cleaned spotlessly, as was the pools and all public areas. Food wise there is something for everyone. Entertainment was good and one of the funniest things we have ever seen was the Miss Concorde competition! All the entrants were Russian and some took it very seriously, we could not believe what we were watching and thought it was hysterical!! I wont spoil it for those going, but just go and watch it, its side splitting!!!! We were that impressed by this holiday that we have already made enquiries to go again and have recommended the Concorde el Salam to our family and friends.
reviews.title: Fab hotel, staff, food weather,snorkkeling, just go there!!!

likes.liked: — Extra large rooms with very comfortable beds and spotless
likes.disliked: — No tea & coffee facilities though room serivce is cheap so just order your hot drinks

reviews.text: I have just got back from Holiday staying at the Concorde El Salem Hotel in Sharm El Sheikh. If you have any reservations about about Egypt let me put your mind at rest. The hotel was spotless. I even had a tour of the kitchens and they were fantastic. The food was fab with loads of choice hot and cold which was NOT repetitive night after night. They even did steak & kidney pie one night with pastry to die for. The puddings all homemade were scrummy with at least 24 different sweets to choose from. They bake all of their own bread and the choice of breads and rolls alone was unbelievable. My daughter who is 12 yrs ate far more on holiday than she does at home and she is really fussy about her food.
reviews.title: Fab hotel, just a few niggles...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities in the hotel are excellent. The swimming pools are spotless and the ground around the pools are being cleaned all of the time. The staff were absolutely brilliant. They cannot do enough for you. Tipping is a way of life and I found that tipping little and often the best policy and you will be assured of a good table at dinner and drinks are repelnished without even asking.
reviews.title: Booked again for next year

likes.liked: — Deluxe room was lovely. Food excellent. Friendly staff.

reviews.text: We stayed in the sports section and was planning on upgrading to the main upon arrival but we had a great room overlooking the pool and you are never too far from the pool, restaurant, reception etc wereas you could be quite some way away from the facilities in the main part of the hotel. I also think that the outside dining area is better at the sports hotel than the main. It is more intimate with the tables spaced further apart. You can use all of the facilities at either hotel andd there is a courtesy buss running between every 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Ok - but watch out for the mosquitoes!!!
